channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Harrowing moment teenager begs for help after her miniature pinscher was mauled to death
item.description: GRAPHIC CONTENT: Renata Aladenika, 18, was walking Rocco in Woolwich Common when she claims a bullmastiff rushed over and sank its teeth into her dog's neck.

item.title: How Harry and Meghan snapped up $14.7m dream home from Russian tycoon
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle purchased their dream seven-acre California home from the Russian oligarch Sergey Grishin, 54, nicknamed the 'Scarface Oligarch'.

item.title: Victoria announces 372 new coronavirus cases and another 14 deaths
item.description: Victoria has recorded another 372 new coronavirus cases overnight and 14 deaths.

item.title: Gavin Williamson would get three Fs for 'fail', writes SIMON WALTERS
item.description: SIMON WALTERS: The problems wrought by coronavirus would have challenged some of the finest statesmen in history. So it's not surprising that Gavin Williamson is having difficulty.

item.title: 'ISIS fanatic' accused of attack plot says group 'created by US'
item.description: Hisham Muhammad, 26, (pictured) is accused of planning a 'lone-wolf attack' in Manchester using knives and other weapons, with the armed forces or police as possible targets.

item.title: JANET STREET-PORTER: Somebody needs to draft Harry an exit plan
item.description: JANET STREET PORTER: Santa Barbara is California's well heeled version of Sandbanks in Dorset, a safe haven for the very elderly and the extremely rich.

item.title: Victorian pews removed from 700-year-old village church
item.description: A row over the pews at St Andrew's church in Okeford Fitzpaine, Dorset has come to an end. Protests were in vain and the church's 32 Victorian pews are being replaced with Ikea-type chairs.

item.title: Sumner Redstone leaves behind a private life more lurid than his films, writes TOM LEONARD
item.description: TOM LEONARD: There were just two things that kept Sumner Redstone happy each day in his final years, said a girlfriend - sex and steak.

item.title: Beauty salons will be able to offer eyebrow threading and facials from Saturday
item.description: Tattoo studios, spas and barbers will also be able to offer all 'close contact' services, including eyelash treatments, under new guidance and indoor soft play areas, bowling alleys and casinos will also open.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Tourists in France WILL have to quarantine
item.description: The quarantine is set to come in at 4am on Saturday - and with an estimated British 500,000 holidaymakers in France, a weekend of chaos looms.

item.title: Despair and delight of UK's Covid exam generation
item.description: Identical twin sisters Arianne and Enyala Banks (pictured) are setting off to Oxford together - but will finally be separated as they go to different colleges.

item.title: Met Police chief Dame Cressida Dick says her force is NOT institutionally racist
item.description: Britain's most senior police officer told Channel 4 News today that allegations around racism in the Met were not 'helpful' labels for the force.

item.title: Donald Trump reveals deal for Israel to ABANDON plan to annex Palestinian territory
item.description: The announcement makes the UAE the first Gulf Arab state with diplomatic relations with Israel. In return Netanyahu's shaky coalition is dropping plan to annex Palestinian territory.

item.title: Facebook tells users the source and date of coronavirus stories before they share them
item.description: Facebook has rolled out a new notification feature that displays the date and source of articles about coronavirus before a users re-share the content in a bid to cut down on misinformation. .

item.title: £3,200 fines for shunning face masks: Payment of £100 will keep on doubling for repeat offenders
item.description: The Prime Minister said those caught without a mask for a second time will now face a fine of £200, with the amount doubling on every repeat offence to a maximum of £3,200.

item.title: Move to limit price of Funerals gets shelved but firms preying on families still face crackdown
item.description: The CMA launched an investigation into the UK's £2billion-a-year funeral industry last year amid concerns rogue firms were exploiting grieving families, but proposals to control fees have been hindered.

item.title: Tiny Channel Island of Sark tries to DOUBLE its 492 population
item.description: The Channel Island of Sark, which is nestled in between Guernsey and Jersey, is now trying to rescue its dwindling population of 492 and raise it by another 500.

item.title: 300-1 shot He Knows No Fear makes horse racing history at Leopardstown
item.description: He Knows No Fear made British and Irish racing history. The Betfair starting price was 1,000-1 but his industry SP of 300-1 meant he usurped the previous 250-1 record broken in 1990.

item.title: Poor care is 'the norm' at baby scandal hospitals: Standards are still falling at NHS trust
item.description: The Care Quality Commission said that poor care is the norm at Shrewsbury and Telford. Inspectors singled out incompetent leadership and out-of-their-depth staff at the NHS trust.

item.title: Poorer pupils are worst hit by A-level results fiasco with 10% seeing marks downgraded
item.description: A government computer algorithm altered grades that had been recommended by teachers, with 40 per cent of all exams being downgraded.

item.title: Armed police Taser man who doused himself in lighter fluid
item.description: The street - in Little London, Leeds - was flooded with police officers and ambulance workers as the area was cordoned off for the neighbours' safety while officers dealt with the incident.

item.title: BBC confirms EastEnders will be back on air NEXT MONTH
item.description: After almost three months off air, BBC bosses joked that they 'can't wait for series two', after the soap previously ran uninterrupted for 35 years.

item.title: London's Hammersmith Bridge is closed amid fears it could COLLAPSE
item.description: The suspension bridge in west London was closed 'indefinitely' to motorists in April last year after 'critical faults' were detected in the ironwork.

item.title: Epic sues Apple after 'Fornite' video game is pulled from the App store
item.description: Apple pulled Epic Game's wildly popular Fornite from its App Store, as the developer violated the tech giant's in-app payment guidelines. Epic is not taking the move lightly and is suing the tech giant.

item.title: World's most expensive fish, bluefin tuna, are photographed off the English coast by stunned kayaker
item.description: Bluefin tuna are the most valuable species of fish in the world - once selling at record £2.5m. Kayaker Rupert Kirkwood, 60, photographed the bluefin tuna three miles off Plymouth on Tuesday.

item.title: Spectators will be allowed to attend World Snooker Championship final
item.description: The Government confirmed pilot events for the safe return of crowds will restart on Saturday at Sheffield's Crucible Theatre for the World Snooker Championship final.

item.title: Economist proposes US slavery reparations up to $12TN
item.description: Duke University professor William Darity Jr and his wife Kirsten Mullen co-authored the report for the Roosevelt Institute arguing that the U.S. government should pay 'systemic reparations' for slavery.

item.title: Beachgoer suffers serious burns as fire hits Cornwall restaurant
item.description: Emergency services rushed to the scene after the blaze started at The Balcony Bar and Kitchen in St Ives, Cornwall, just after 3.20pm today and left one beachgoer with 'serious burns'.

item.title: Hit-and-run drunk driver who left victim for dead is spared jail, after offering to pay him £10,000
item.description: Stephen Andrews, 41, caused taxi driver Inam Ulhaq such severe injuries in the horrific head-on impact in Wigan last year that he was unable to cradle his newborn child, a court heard.

item.title: Gary Lineker WILL welcome migrants into his home - and calls for Tory MP to 'offer his own house'
item.description: Gary Lineker has offered up his south west London home for migrants to live in after they cross the Channel - calling out a Tory MP who accused him of virtue signalling

item.title: Seal hitches a ride on stand-up paddle board at Dorset beach
item.description: The seal, known as Sammy by locals in Weymouth, Dorset has become a regular sight for beachgoers. Sammy is even known to approach people on the beach.

item.title: Who says 70 can't be sexy? These women are all in their eighth decade. So what's their secret?
item.description: Four other timeless beauties in their 70s tell JILL FOSTER how they have held back the clock after pictures of fashion designer Vera Wang sent social media users into a frenzy

item.title: Fruit flies' mating ritual starts with SINGING and ends with sex
item.description: Video footage reveals the mysterious mating habits of fruit flies. When a male attempts to attract a female through song, the female extracts a tubular organ that signals she is interested.

item.title: Author Noriko Morishita draws parallels between the art of Japanese tea making and life
item.description: Like the Japanese tea ceremony life has its many unspoken rules we obey.Here Noriko Morishita divulges the wisdom of tea - savour the now. Tea is an opportunity to forget life's pressures says Noriko.

item.title: The Few were barely out of school, prematurely aged by the awful choice...Kill or be killed
item.description: This thoughtful book, first published 35 years ago and now reissued for this year's Battle of Britain 80th anniversary, reveals the reality of Churchill's Few. Author John Willis does not pull his punches.

item.title: Grey reef sharks form lasting 'friendships,' scientists find, rarely straying into outside groups
item.description: Grey reef sharks are not so heartless as previously believed. These predators have been found to form long-lasting 'friendships,' with those in their social circle and meet at the same spot everyday.

item.title: Rich men, diamonds and casual sex were a way of life for Sarah Aspinall's mother
item.description: Sarah Aspinall recalls her crazily erratic childhood in a memoir about her mother Audrey. Author discovered her mother was born in Liverpool and spent her childhood dodging the police.

item.title: Coming to a screen near you!
item.description: The annual Henley Literary Festival in the picturesque Oxfordshire town of Henley-on-Thames will take place online this year. The star-studded line-up includes Kate Humble.

item.title: Birmingham man's SEVEN hair transplants put him in debt
item.description: David Anderson, from Birmingham, appeared in Channel 5's Plastic Surgery Knifemares tonight to discuss a series of botched hair transplants which drove him to into debt and led to his divorce.

item.title: Author's no-holds-barred account of what it's like to see your children in the arms of another woman
item.description: TESS STIMSON: Parenting is a long, hard, unrewarding slog much of the time, but Jelena got to cherry-pick the nice bits, and then take credit for 'raising our boys'.

item.title: Pictured: Father, 62, from Aberdeen who was a passenger on ScotRail train
item.description: Chris Stuchbury, 62, died alongside train driver Brett McCullough, 45, and conductor Donald Dinnie, 58, when a train derailed close to Carmont Railway station.

item.title: Thunderstorms are expected to batter large parts of Britain today before 97F heatwave FINALLY eases
item.description: Several vehicles were left stranded in deep water that had collected between Junction 7 and 8 on London's ring road, causing an 11-mile queue of cars.

item.title: Ladbrokes owner refuses to hand back furlough millions
item.description: FTSE 100 company GVC said it used the taxpayer-funded furlough scheme to temporarily sideline 14,000 shop staff, helping it to cut costs. However it would not commit to returning the money to the Government.

item.title: Kent train smashes into landslide but avoids derailment
item.description: The Southeastern service became unable to move on the track near to West Malling following reports of a landslip due to heavy thunderstorms and rain across Britain.

item.title: Nutrition info on food labels DOES encourage healthy eating
item.description: Researchers from the University of Bath evaluated the impact front-of-pack nutrition labelling - first introduced in 2006 - has on people's buying habits.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan's $14.7m home's $4.4m running costs
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's new California mansion comes with eye-watering bills that could stretch as high as $4.4million per year... so what makes their new property so expensive?

item.title: New Zealand's deputy PM claims coronavirus outbreak started in quarantine breach
item.description: New Zealand's deputy prime minister claims the nation's shock second wave of COVID-19 spread throughout the community following a 'breach' inside the hotel quarantine system.

item.title: Ipswich man, 45, 'beaten to death by three teenagers' after gig
item.description: Richard Day, 45, was punched and kicked by two teenagers aged 16 and one aged 17, outside a Kebapizza takeaway restaurant in Ipswich, Suffolk, on February 22.

item.title: Jesy Nelson shows her TINY dinner of a chicken breast and eight baby carrots
item.description: The Little Mix star, 29, gave a startling insight into her daily diet as she shared a picture of her dinner on Instagram on Wednesday evening.

item.title: 2010s hottest decade on record; sea levels up 3.4" on 1990s
item.description: The last decade was the hottest ever, according to a new report on climate change, with 2019 the second warmest year since record-keeping began some 150 years ago.

item.title: The Crown: Jonathan Pryce 'confident' about Prince Philip role
item.description: The Oscar-nominated actor, 73, will join the star-studded cast of the hit Netflix show and portray the royal through the 1990s and 2000s in seasons five and six.

item.title: Fired McDonald's boss's ex says he changed after CEO promotion
item.description: Steve Easterbrook, 53, was fired from McDonald's last November after he admitted to sexting with an employee, leaving with a $40M severance package.

item.title: Madeleine McCann: Suspect's lawyer thinks he won't be charged
item.description: German Friedrich Fulscher (pictured), the lawyer of the key suspect in the Madeline McCann case Christian Brueckner has said that the witness against him is 'the worst witness you can get'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 18 new fatalities in daily death toll
item.description: The Department of Health today increased the total number of those who have died within 28 days of being diagnosed with coronavirus in the UK to 41,347.

item.title: Coronavirus: Wearing face masks could lower death rate 5%
item.description: Applying the findings to the UK's death toll of 41,329, it suggests face coverings with medical face masks for the elderly and infected could have saved over 4,000 lives (10 per cent).

item.title: MailOnline and Mail titles dominate UK news landscape
item.description: The Mail group's papers and websites dominate the British news landscape, being read by 50 per cent more people than their nearest rivals, a new report by industry watchdog Ofcom reveals.

item.title: Joss Stone angers viewers by saying 'happiness is a choice'
item.description: The multi-millionaire singer, 33, was slammed for being 'out of touch', 'patronising' and 'entitled' as show fans vented their fury on Twitter after her Thursday morning video-link from the Caribbean.

item.title: 'Britain's biggest player' is jailed for four years for battering Gerard Pique's ex-girlfriend
item.description: Daniel Wagster, 31, from Greater Manchester, repeatedly beat and bit his victim in a spate of jealousy fuelled rages, including one row over a fling with footballer Gerard Pique.

item.title: New type of taste bud is discovered that detects almost all flavours
item.description: Academics from the University of Buffalo in the US found a previously undiscovered taste cell which has two signalling pathways and is 'broadly responsive' to almost all flavours.

item.title: Chainsaw-wielding men dripping blood charge on Toronto beach
item.description: People on Cherry Beach in Toronto encountered two shirtless men covered in blood and holding running chainsaws in their hands on Sunday morning following an earlier melee that left them injured.

item.title: Sadiq Khan admits for first time that staff working from home is a 'BIG PROBLEM for central London'.
item.description: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan today admitted coronavirus-fearing companies' empty city offices were killing the economy, declaring 'If we all stay at home working it's a big problem'

item.title: Police officers investigated over handling of grooming gangs
item.description: The inquiry by the Independent Office for Police Conduct (IOPC) will focus on the supervision and handling of Operation Augusta in 2004.

item.title: Win the chance to watch Uefa Final with Eric Cantona in France
item.description: The lucky winner (and a friend) will sit down to watch the game on Sunday, August 23, with the former Man Utd star at the rustic 'Casa de Cantona' in rural Provence.

item.title: Oil executive beat up wife for having glass of wine before lunch
item.description: Quentin Livingston-Taylor, 54, accused his wife of being drunk and lying about it at their Perthshire home. The dispute resulted in an argument which saw the oil executive beat his wife.

item.title: Birmingham youths make brazen escape from police on CCTV
item.description: CCTV footage shows a police car stopping a black vehicle believed to be in Tyseley, Birmingham, on August 11 around 4:55pm, as the officers gets out the car the driver makes a run for it.

item.title: Number of students given university places RISES nearly 3%
item.description: University admissions service Ucas said 358,860 people from across the UK have been accepted so far this year - a 2.9 per cent increase compared to results day 2019.

item.title: Northampton faces coronavirus lockdown after 300 factory workers test positive
item.description: The Greencore food facility on the Midlands town's Moulton Park Industrial Estate has revealed 292 staff there have caught Covid-19 and are self-isolating.

item.title: Open letter by 100 black professionals calls for boycott of BBC
item.description: Over 100 black British professionals have penned an open letter calling for people around the world to boycott the BBC for 24 hours because of their use of the n-word in multiple broadcasts recently.

item.title: Woman's horror as £270 glass coffee table EXPLODES
item.description: Mother-of-two Natalie Nairn, 30, was outside enjoying a barbecue with her family in her garden in Haywood Village, Weston-super-Mare, at the time of the explosion.

item.title: Black and Asian people may be more likely to die of Covid-19 because of POLLUTION
item.description: A report by the Office for National Statistics, looking at links between pollution and Covid-19 deaths in England and Wales, admitted it was 'inconclusive' and the link could work either way.

item.title: Identity of Lindsay Birbeck's teenage killer, 17, revealed
item.description: Rocky Marciano Price, 17, strangled the 47-year-old mother-of-two, who was found wrapped in two plastic bags at the back of a Accrington cemetery.

item.title: Princess Anne is pictured awarding a BAFTA to Sean Connery
item.description: The royal family has shared a selection of photos featuring Princess Anne in the 1990s and 2000s to celebrating the Princess Royal's life ahead of her 70th birthday on Saturday.

item.title: The pictures that made Silvio Berlusconi hell bent on revenge
item.description: Berlusconi's ex-fiancee, Francesca Pascale, 35, was photographed cavorting with her lover, Paolo Turci, 55, on a luxury yacht in Costiera Sorrentina, off Italy's Amalfi coast.

item.title: Fire at Mission: Impossible 7's £2m set after stunt bike explodes
item.description: Plumes of black smoke were seen from the blaze which broke out when the bike landed on pillows filled with cardboard.

item.title: Over 3.8m EU citizens apply to stay in UK after Brexit transition
item.description: Nationals from the bloc and their families must go through the Home Office's settlement scheme by June next year to carry on living and working in the country after the Brexit transition period.

item.title: Kids' playhouse listed on Airbnb as joke booked for £500 a night
item.description: Jason Kneen, 49, built the 8ft (2.4m) by 6ft (1.8m) structure in his Wiltshire garden during lockdown before advertising it on the holiday rental site - but didn't realise to be taken up on his offer.

item.title: Car wash worker sprays INSIDE of car with high-pressure hose
item.description: A bizarre video showing a car wash employee spraying the inside of a 4WD with a high-pressure hose was defended by the business owner as a common cleaning method.

item.title: Woolly rhinos were wiped out by climate change not humans
item.description: Experts from Stockholm University sequenced ancient DNA taken from 14 woolly rhinoceros fossils to find out the state of their population near the end.

item.title: Girl, 15, died during routine surgery at Great Ormond Street Hospital to have four teeth removed
item.description: Denisa Alexandra Stefanoaia, known as Alex, died at Great Ormond Street Hospital (GOSH) in London after complications during the operation, which would allow her to have a brace.

item.title: BBC diversity boss June Sarpong admits corporation is 'nowhere near' hitting its own targets
item.description: June Sarpong, 43, yesterday told Radio 4's The Media Show that she believes the BBC is diverse at 'entry level' but 'not enough in terms of mid-level and senior leadership'.

item.title: Woman accidentally set face on fire lighting cigarette on hob
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. As Louise Tanner, 50, from Worthing, West Sussex, leaned over the hob, her hair, which had hairspray in, instantly went up in flames.

item.title: Investigators begin probe into ScotRail train derailment that killed three
item.description: An annual report by rail safety watchdog, the Office of Rail and Road , said there were six times more flooding events on Britain's railways in 2019-20 than during the previous 12 months.

item.title: France sends its Navy to the eastern Mediterranean in support of Greece
item.description: The French military said two Rafale jets would arrive Thursday on the island of Crete for a stay of 'several days', after having taken part in a military exercise in Cyprus earlier in the week.

item.title: Student raises over £20,000 for homeless 'Stormzy lookalike'
item.description: An A-level student has raised more than £25,000 for a homeless man named Akwasi, 29, after a video of his polite reaction to being heckled on the street went viral.

item.title: Could YOU understand the A-level grades algorithm?
item.description: The formula by exam regulator Ofqual predicts the distribution of grades for each individual school or college, based on the historical performance of the institution in that subject.

item.title: Activists record 'torture victims' screams' from Belarus prison
item.description: In a video uploaded to Twitter by euroradio.fm , showing the outside of Akrestina prison in Minsk, screams - allegedly those of tortured protesters - can be heard crying out in the night.

item.title: Ex-con who was locked up with Charles Bronson says 'caring' lag has 'a lot to offer society now'
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Stephen Gillen, 49, who now lives in Windsor, Berks, was incarcerated next door to Bronson while a category A inmate at Woodhill Prison's close supervision unit in the late Nineties.

item.title: War veteran slams police for failing to charge protester after BLM Union Jack burning incident
item.description: Trevor Coult, awarded the Military Cross for shooting three suicide bombers in an ambush in Iraq, has called on police to charge a protester arrested over an attempt to burn Union Jack in London.

item.title: Teenager, 17, is feared drowned after swimming in quarry lagoon during heatwave
item.description: College student Haider Ali, 17, and his friends were cooling off in the sweltering 34C heat yesterday at Shavers End Quarry, near Stourport-on-Severn, Worcestershire.

item.title: Seal forced to tow children in a boat with a rope tied around its neck at an animal park in Belgium
item.description: Two of the animals were filmed swimming in a water attraction at the Mont Mosan animal park, Huy, in the province of Liege.

item.title: Record 1.85million patients in England now waiting 18+ weeks for hospital treatment
item.description: Data released by NHS England showed that the number of people who have been waiting for more than a year for an operation or procedure is 50 times higher than it was in June 2019.

item.title: Woman is horrified to find a spy camera installed in her bathroom by her best friend's husband
item.description: The Chinese woman, known by her pseudonym Xiao Ni, suddenly spotted the small black stick falling onto the floor while she was showering, police said. The suspect has been detained.

item.title: Finding Freedom book faces criticism from Amazon UK readers
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan Markle's, 39, explosive new biography Finding Freedom is facing criticism from Amazon UK readers over its 'sugar-coated' and 'sickly sweet' view of the couple.

item.title: Microsoft's Surface Duo smartphone to be released next month
item.description: The $1,399 mobile device, first announced last year, unfolds to reveal two displays which can be used individually or together as a single 8.1-inch screen.

item.title: Achileas of Greece celebrates in black tie on his 20th birthday
item.description: Prince Achileas-Andreas of Greece, 20, revealed on Instagram that he celebrated his birthday while rocking out on drums wearing a full black tie suit and velvet blue loafers.

item.title: Heartwarming transformation of a rescue dog who was found covered with TAR in India
item.description: A new video released by PETA has shown the transformation of rescue dog Champi - who was nursed back to health after being found stuck to the pavement and covered with tar in Solapur, India.

item.title: Man, 38, faked cancer to stop girlfriend, 50, leaving him
item.description: Kevin Bevis, 38, from Kent, lied about being terminally ill to Karen Gregory, 50. But his deceit came to an end when she went to the police after he became violent and Bevis was jailed for 18 months.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: NHS contact tracing app re-launches in trials
item.description: The Department of Health today announced it is re-launching the contact tracing app in trials in England after its first version was abandoned in June because it didn't work on iPhones.

item.title: Cruel thieves gouge out tracker chips from dogs in Ireland
item.description: Pooches Topsy and Daisy had chunks gouged out of their flesh by dog-nappers, when they were taken from their homes in Dublin and Enniscorthy, Wexford on 4 July.

item.title: Black Irish woman shares video of unprovoked racist abuse
item.description: In the unprovoked racist attack, a white man crosses the road in Galway and aggressively shouts the n-word at the woman in broad daylight.

item.title: Spanish region bans smoking in outdoor public places in attempt to fight coronavirus
item.description: The ban came into effect Thursday in Spain's northwestern region of Galicia, with other areas mulling similar restrictions to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: British tourist tests positive for coronavirus at Greek hotel
item.description: The tourist, whose identity has not been revealed, was tested after landing in Corfu on August 3 as part of the country's randomised screening measures.

item.title: Wildlife filmmaker is surrounded by playful seals who swam alongside her in the sea off Cornwall
item.description: Ellen Husain, a marine biologist, was in the water for over an hour with the seals, who become very interested in her flippers, near Falmouth on the south coast of Cornwall earlier this week.

item.title: Liz Truss urges US to lift trade tariffs on single malt spirits
item.description: US trade representative Robert Lighthizer ruled out additional taxes on gin and blended whisky, but duty on higher quality single malts will remain, to the fury of the industry in Scotland.

item.title: Consultant anaesthetist was punched in face by ex-wife
item.description: Consultant anaesthetist Dr Anthony Doyle was 'shocked' when Vicki Doyle struck him to the side of the face after he called her a 'psychopath' in an ugly row outside his home in Bradford Peverell, Dorset.

item.title: East London street gets brightly-coloured mural makeover
item.description: The London Mural Company gave Aberfeldy Street, Poplar, a colourful boost with more than 600 litres of paint and 200 spray cans over the past six weeks.

item.title: Couple raffle £475,000 home with studio for £2.50 a ticket
item.description: Former professional snowboarder Jan Michaelis told FEMAIL he 'reluctantly' decided to put the West Wittering home on the market to find somewhere bigger for his growing family.

item.title: Empty plot of land overlooking Poole Harbour on sale for £3.5m
item.description: The empty plot of land with overgrown grass and uneven concrete runs down to the edge of Poole Harbour in Sandbanks, Dorset and has one of the finest views of the Millionaire's Row.

item.title: Policewoman allowed to keep job after sex act on sergeant
item.description: PC Jemma Dicks, 28, performed the sex act on Sergeant Adam Reed, 40, at Cardiff Central Police Station during a 10 month fling. She was given a final written warning. Reed has already quit the force.

item.title: People share funny comments they've overheard from neighbours
item.description: An anonymous woman, from the UK, has taken to Mumsnet to ask people to share some of the most amusing conversations they have overheard while out in their gardens.

item.title: Nasal spray could prevent people from catching the coronavirus, scientists claim
item.description: The University of California formulated 'AeroNabs' for use once a day. They hope it will act as a short-term tool to prevent Covid-19 infection before a vaccine is found.

item.title: Jeremy Clarkson pokes fun at A-level exams chaos as he boasts about receiving a C and 2Us
item.description: Jeremy Clarkson posts a similar tweet to his 7.2 million followers on A-level results day every year to reassure students who didn't get the results they wanted.

item.title: Pensioner caused a massive traffic jam by driving his mobility scooter on a MOTORWAY
item.description: The OAP - believed to be 88 - was spotted in the fast lane on the motorised buggy which can only do 6mph in the Julio Luengo tunnel in Las Palmas on the Canary Island of Gran Canaria.

item.title: Dominic Cummings creates No10 'control centre' in Whitehall in ongoing 'power grab'
item.description: Mr Cummings and another of Mr Johnson's top advisers Munira Mirza, are to leave No10 to set up a new 'control centre' for the PM in 70 Whitehall, the current home of the Cabinet Office.

item.title: Meghan Markle planned to 'go out with a bang' for her Farewell Tour, according to Finding Freedom
item.description: Meghan Markle, 39, and her makeup artist Daniel Martin joked about 'going out with a bang' when planning her showstopping outfits for her farewell tour in March, according to Finding Freedom.

item.title: Iranian special forces board oil tanker and seize it for hours
item.description: The US Central Command posted a grainy black-and-white video online showing a helicopter hovering low over the Liberian-flagged MT Wila near the city of Khorfakkan.

item.title: Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte take a break in the Cote d'Azur
item.description: The couple took their staycation near Fort de Bregancon, the medieval fortress on the Cote d'Azur which has been the official retreat of French presidents since 1968.

item.title: Spain's former King Juan Carlos is with lover of 40 years in Abu Dhabi hotel, royal expert claims
item.description: The controversial Juan Carlos, 82, is believed to be with his 'most faithful friend for the past 40 years' in a £10,000-a-night presidential suite at one of the world's most expensive hotels in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Man smashes car window with an AXE to rescue Yorkshire Terrier
item.description: The panting dog was rescued from the back seat of VW Golf at the Newbury Retail Park in Berkshire as Britain sweltered in 34C (93F) temperatures.

item.title: Mum, 28, who dated man, 40, online during lockdown reveals they got engaged FOUR weeks after meeting
item.description: Hannah Harvey, 28, from Silver End, Essex, matched with Gregg Wright, 40, from Chelmsford, on dating site Badoo in April.

item.title: Britain's first black TV journalist, 79, said bosses axed her after racist viewers' complaints
item.description: The first black journalist on British television relived today how station management axed her after showing her letters from racist viewers demanding 'Get that n-word off our screens'.

item.title: Russia's top doctor quits over 'gross violations' of ethics that rushed through Covid-19 'vaccine'
item.description: Amid deep scepticism among Western experts over the drug, it appears Prof Alexander Chuchalin sought and failed to block its registration on 'safety' grounds before quitting the ethics council.

item.title: Priti Patel vows NO more money for France unless it takes back more Channel migrants
item.description: The Home Secretary told Tory MPs that she was preparing sweeping legal changes that would 'send the left into meltdown', as migrants arrived in Dover for the 10th day in a row.

item.title: Have YOU got '2020 burnout'? Experts reveal why you're feeling so depleted right now
item.description: If you've been feeling exhausted, depleted and down more than usual, you're not alone. In fact, experts say you're probably just one of the thousands struggling with '2020 burnout'.

item.title: Brainteaser challenges puzzlers to find the real mouse hidden among the computer mice
item.description: A new brainteaser, created by UK-based Oxbridge, has challenged puzzlers to spot the real mouse hiding among the computer mice - so do you think you can beat the impressive 15-second record?

item.title: Calais Mayor says UK has 'declared maritime war' on France
item.description: Mayor Natacha Bouchart responded to Priti Patel's formal request for help from the MoD as the number of people making the life-threatening journey across the Channel continues to climb.

item.title: Coronavirus: World leaders 'mimicked each other's lockdowns'
item.description: Swedish researchers found most of the 36 countries they analysed jumped into a lockdown within the same two-week period in March, despite having different size outbreaks.
